title: Client closed itself loading a match
body:
I started up a ranked match and things were fine till I got to the loading screen where it was taking a while to load me in and when it got to 100% the client just closed itself without any warning. Has this happened to anyone else? Also this is the first time it happened to me. I was using the legacy client since the new client still gives me some issues at champ select. While typing this post I was trying to start another match and when I was in champ select I was in the middle of typing when the client just closed itself again. I have never had this issue before and I do not know what is causing it. Lately my game will sometimes freeze at the end of a match right after a nexus is destroyed and resume after a long delay. I am not sure if that is related to the issue now happening to me or not, but I figure I might as well mention it just in case.

Edit: Loaded into a match and was at 100%, but the client kicked me out of the loading screen and by the time I realized and tried to reconnect my team remade and I got put in low priority. I am getting really annoyed of this. Now I have to play 5 matches with 20 mins because the client crashed twice and kicked me out once.

replies.body: The game and client are independent, so the loading screen would not be impacted by switching to the updated version.  It sounds like something is having issues keeping a strong connection so it's failing to transition you between game and pvp.net servers.  Run through our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot, and use custom games to test it out.  Let me know if you have any questions!

I am connected to ethernet, and what would have caused me to get kicked from the loading screen when I was at 100%?

There could be a few factors like a block, a hiccup, or even your ISP taking a long time to reach us.  It's really hard to say for sure without some more troubleshooting or error messages, but these are the most common occurrences.  As nice as it is to be on ethernet, it doesn't make one immune from network problems.  Hope that helps clear things up!
